cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 225 miles east of Caibarién, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving W then turning WNW/NW, expected to track through the Florida Keys Sunday, up the Florida peninsula and near/over northeast Florida Monday before moving into Georgia

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch north of Jupiter Inlet to the Flagler/Volusia County Line; Storm Surge Watch north of Sebastian Inlet to Ponce Inlet
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Jupiter Inlet southward around the Florida peninsula to Bonita Beach, including the Keys; Storm Surge Warning Sebastian Inlet southward around the peninsula to Venice
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida coast, especially Keys to northeastern Florida, then Georgia and South Carolina coasts
weather_observation.wind: High likelihood (up to 75%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds with a 36% chance of 50-kt winds; gusts near hurricane force possible as the core passes inland just west of the port Monday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential inundation of 3-5 ft possible along the lower St. Johns River and adjacent Atlantic beaches if Irma’s track and on-shore flow coincide with high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–12 inches of rain with isolated amounts up to 16 inches expected across northeast Florida, producing flash-flood risk.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents ahead of the storm; isolated tornadoes in outer rain-bands.
